column5: In respect of the joint labour committees and registered employment agreements, if I understood him correctly, the Minister indicated there would be a period of consultation and debate and then legislation arising therefrom.  However, if this is the case, does he not consider it to be an outrageous pre-emption of the consultative process——
——for the Minister to tell Members that he essentially disregards this report?
It pre-empts any debate and I wonder whether the Labour Party will have any input——
Is it Bruton's way or the Labour Party's way?
